item.title: In Leaked Video, Romney Shows Disdain for Obama Voters, 'Entitled' 'Victims'
item.description: Yay! Mitt Romney may not care about people like me.......good.....the feeling is mutual. http://t.co/EOuQlldv #Election2012
item.content:encoded: Yay! Mitt Romney may not care about people like me.......good.....the feeling is mutual. http://t.co/EOuQlldv #Election2012 Charles Dharapak/AP Photo Leaked video of Republican nominee Mitt Romney at closed-door fundraisers show him using some very different talking points from the ones he tends to use publicly.  He is shown the videos saying that “no matter what” he does, 47 percent of the population is going to vote for Obama because they are “are dependent upon government.” In one portion of the speech Romney says he “was born with a silver spoon” but in other he says he “inherited nothing.” The video clips, which were posted by Mother Jones, show Romney telling donors that 47 percent of voters… Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abcnews.go.com

item.title: Today, Mitt Romney Lost the Election
item.description: We've all been forced to wonder what Mitt Romney really feels. Today we got an answer: He feels that you're a loser. http://t.co/dTtv2r2J
item.content:encoded: We've all been forced to wonder what Mitt Romney really feels. Today we got an answer: He feels that you're a loser. http://t.co/dTtv2r2J You can mark my prediction now: A secret recording from a closed-door Mitt Romney fundraiser, released today by David Corn at Mother Jones, has killed Mitt Romney's campaign for president. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Exclusive - Sarah Palin: Did Joe McGinniss Condemn an Innocent Man?
item.description: Exclusive - Sarah Palin: Did Joe McGinniss Condemn an Innocent Man?: I don’t normally read “true crime” books, a... http://t.co/J94pb4Dc
item.content:encoded: Exclusive - Sarah Palin: Did Joe McGinniss Condemn an Innocent Man?: I don’t normally read “true crime” books, a... http://t.co/J94pb4Dc What McGinniss did in my town and to my family was sick and vicious. I sympathize with MacDonald and his defense team because I saw firsthand the twisted way McGinniss operates. Before he moved in right next door to spy on us, he stalked us for months, making creepy unwelcomed “visits” to our house, as he tried to manipulatively win our trust the same way he won the trust of MacDonald and his defense team – all so that he could betray us just as he betrayed them. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: Media having a little narrative problem today? - Hot Air
item.description: Media having a little narrative problem today? http://t.co/5Dx1HkUp #tcot #sgp
item.content:encoded: Media having a little narrative problem today? http://t.co/5Dx1HkUp #tcot #sgp It’s not often that I laugh out loud while reading my e-mail (and that’s not an invitation to forward the jokes from 1996 still circulating, either), but today’s entries left me no choice. No less than three media outlets have scoops about the Mitt Romney campaign this morning that describe changes in strategy and direction. The only problem is that all three contradict each other despite having come from sources inside the campaign. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: hotair.com

item.title: General Motors pushing U.S. to sell stake: report
item.description: GM WANTS OUT OF GOV'T; OBAMA SAYS NO http://t.co/I0Nvp1H0
item.content:encoded: GM WANTS OUT OF GOV'T; OBAMA SAYS NO http://t.co/I0Nvp1H0 CHICAGO (MarketWatch) -- The Treasury Department is resisting General Motors' push for the government to sell off its stake in the auto maker, The Wall Street Journal reports. Following a $50 billion bailout in 2009, the U.S. taxpayers now own almost 27% of the company. But the newspaper said GM executives are now chafing at that, saying it hurts the company's reputation and its ability to attract top talent due to pay restrictions. Earlier this year, GM presented a plan to repurchase 200 million of the 500 million shares the U.S. holds with the balance being sold via a public offering. But officials at the Treasury Department were not interested as selling now would lead to a multibillion dollar loss for the government, the newspaper noted. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: marketwatch.com

item.title: Morning Bell: Our Constitution Is Under Fire
item.description: Morning Bell: Our Constitution Is Under Fire: Today, the federal government has acquired an all but un... http://t.co/iboj8Rz2 @heritage
item.content:encoded: Morning Bell: Our Constitution Is Under Fire: Today, the federal government has acquired an all but un... http://t.co/iboj8Rz2 @heritage While we face many challenges, the most difficult task ahead—and the most important—is to restore constitutional limits on government. Forty visionaries signed a piece of paper 225 years ago today that became one of the most vital documents in the world: the U.S. Constitution. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: heritage.org

item.title: People Want the Real You
item.description:
Via Chris Brogan: People Want the Real You:
If you are a solo business and you use the term ... http://t.co/KbUYfxRy #marketing #brand
item.content:encoded: Via Chris Brogan: People Want the Real You: If you are a solo business and you use the term ... http://t.co/KbUYfxRy #marketing #brand If you are a solo business and you use the term “we,” stop it. If you are an employee at some major company and are trying to be the navy polo and blue chinos version of who you really are, enough. It’s time to give up on being Clark Kent or… do you know what? The most mainstream female superhero is Wonder Woman, but if I type in “Diana Prince,” almost no one will get it. But now you do. Okay, back on track, team. People want the real you! Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: chrisbrogan.com
